Penyidik KPK Limpahkan 4 Tersangka Penyuap Bupati Bengkayang ke Penuntutan
01 Nov 2019, 20:47 by Eko Sulestyono


Penyidik KPK Limpahkan 4 Tersangka Penyuap Bupati Bengkayang ke Penuntutan

KBRN, Jakarta : Penyidik Komisi Pemberantasan Korupsi (KPK) telah selesai melakukan proses penyidikan terhadap 4 orang  tersangka dalam kasus dugaan  suap. Kasus itu diduga melibatkan tersangka Suryadman Gidot, Bupati Bengkayang, Kalimantan Barat (Kalbar) non aktif. 
Kabiro Humas KPK Febri Diansyah menjelaskan dalam waktu dekat keempat tersangka itu akan segera menjalani persidangan. Menurut Febri, hari ini penyidik telah melimpahkannya ke penuntutan. 
"Penyidikan 4 orang tersangka terkait suap proyek pekerjaan di Pemerintah Kabupaten Bengkayang, Kalimantan Barat (Kalbar) tahun 2019 selesai, penyidik menyerahkan tersangka, berkas, dan barang bukti ke penuntutan," kata Febri Diansyah di Jakarta, Jumat (1/11/2019).
Febri menjelaskan bahwa keempat tersangka itu masing-masing Rodi, Yosef, Bun Sifat dan Nelly Margaretha yang ditenggarai sebagai pihak pemberi suap atau penyuap.
Menurut Febri, persidangan keempat tersangka itu rencananya akan dilaksanakan di Gedung Pengadilan Tipikor Pontianak, Kalbar. Penyidik KPK telah meminta keterangan 100 orang saksi dalam kasus ini.
“Saksi-saksi itu berasal dari berbagai unsur mulai dari Wakil Bupati Bengkayang, sejumlah pejabat di lingkungan Pemkab Bengkayang hingga pihak swasta” kata Febri.
Sementara itu sebelumnya penyidik KPK telah menetapkan Suryadman Gidot sebagai tersangka  diduga perima suap. Suryadman diduga menerima uang sebesar Rp 340 juta dari sejumlah pihak swasta, yang diberikan melalui perantaraan Alexius, Kepala Dinas PUPR Pemerintah Kabupaten (Pemkab) Bengkayang.
Penyidik KPK juga menetapkan Alexius sebagai tersangka, Alexius bersama Suryadman Gidot diduga telah menerima suap dari 5 orang pengusaha. Kelima pengusaha itu masing-masing Rodi, Yosef, Nelly Margaretha, Bun Si Fat, dan Pandus, mereka disangkakan sebegai pihak pemberi suap atau penyuap.

KPK Investigators Delegate 4 Bengkayang Regent Bribes Suspects to Prosecution
01 Nov 2019, 20:47 by Eko Sulestyono


KPK Investigators Delegate 4 Bengkayang Regent Bribes Suspects to Prosecution

KBRN, Jakarta: Investigators of the Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) have completed a process of investigating 4 suspects in a bribery case. The case allegedly involved the suspect Suryadman Gidot, Bengkayang Regent, West Kalimantan (Kalbar), who was not active.
KPK Head of Public Relations, Febri Diansyah, explained that in the near future the four suspects will soon undergo trial. According to Febri, investigators have delegated him to the prosecution today.
"Investigation of 4 suspects related to bribery of work projects in the Bengkayang Regency Government, West Kalimantan (West Kalimantan) in 2019 is complete, investigators hand over suspects, files and evidence to the prosecution," said Febri Diansyah in Jakarta, Friday (11/01/2019) .
Febri explained that the four suspects were Rodi, Joseph, Bun Properties and Nelly Margaretha who were suspected of being bribes or bribes.
According to Febri, the trial of the four suspects is planned to be held at the Pontianak Corruption Court Building, West Kalimantan. KPK investigators have requested information from 100 witnesses in this case.
"The witnesses came from various elements ranging from the Deputy Regent of Bengkayang, a number of officials in the Bengkayang Regency Government to the private sector," said Febri.
Meanwhile, KPK investigators had previously named Suryadman Gidot as a suspect suspected of being a bribe. Suryadman allegedly received Rp 340 million from a number of private parties, which was provided through the mediation of Alexius, Head of the Bengkayang Regency Government PUPR Service.
KPK investigators also set Alexius as a suspect, Alexius along with Suryadman Gidot allegedly had received bribes from 5 businessmen. The five businessmen were Rodi, Yosef, Nelly Margaretha, Bun Si Fat, and Pandus, who were accused of being bribes or bribes.
